io.spine.client

Class Subscriptions

  • java.lang.Object
    • io.spine.client.Subscriptions
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    io.spine.logging.Logging

    public final class Subscriptions
extends java.lang.Object
implements io.spine.logging.Logging
    Maintains the list of the active subscriptions created by the Client.

    Subscriptions are created when a client application:

    • subscribes to events;
    • subscribes to entity states;
    • posts a command.

    The subscriptions should be cancelled after an update is delivered to the client and no further updates are expected.

    All remaining subscriptions are cancelled by the Client when it closes.

    See Also:
    ClientRequest.subscribeTo(Class), ClientRequest.subscribeToEvent(Class), CommandRequest.post()

      • generateId

        public static io.spine.client.SubscriptionId generateId()
        Generates a new subscription identifier.

        The result is based upon UUID generation.

        Returns:
        new subscription identifier.

      • newId

        public static io.spine.client.SubscriptionId newId(java.lang.String value)
        Wraps a given String as a subscription identifier.

        Should not be used in production. Use automatic generation instead.

        Returns:
        new subscription identifier.

      • from

        Returns:

      • toShortString

        @Deprecated
public static java.lang.String toShortString(io.spine.client.Subscription s)
        Deprecated. please use SubscriptionMixin.toShortString()
        Obtains a short printable form of subscription.

        Standard AbstractMessage.toString() includes all subscription data and thus its output is too huge to use in short log messages and stack traces.

        Returns:
        a printable String with core subscription data

      • cancel

        @CanIgnoreReturnValue
public boolean cancel(io.spine.client.Subscription s)
        Requests cancellation the passed subscription.

        The cancellation of the subscription is done asynchronously.

        Returns:
        true if the subscription was previously made

      • cancelAll

        public void cancelAll()
        Requests cancellation of all subscriptions.

      • isEmpty

        public boolean isEmpty()
        Verifies if there are any active subscriptions.
